function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reduction in public transport ridership","Impact":"Decreased access to public transportation increases the use of private vehicles, leading to higher vehicle emissions and air pollution.","Mitigation":"Investing in safe and effective public transportation and promoting alternative modes of transportation such as cycling and walking.","Technologies":"Smart ticketing systems, real-time passenger information apps, and air quality monitoring sensors in public transport.","People":"Commuters, residents in urban areas, and vulnerable populations.","Owner":"Government, public transportation authorities, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Mass unemployment and increase in home working","Impact":"Economic instability and increased indoor occupancy, leading to potential overcrowding and compromised indoor air quality.","Mitigation":"Supporting remote work infrastructure and creating guidelines for indoor air quality and ventilation in residential buildings.","Technologies":"Telecommuting platforms, indoor air quality monitors, and ventilation systems with high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters.","People":"Employers, remote workers, and residents in densely populated areas.","Owner":"Employers, building managers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Decrease in air and noise pollution","Impact":"Improvement in local air quality and reduction in environmental noise, leading to positive impacts on public health and well-being.","Mitigation":"Investing in sustainable transportation, promoting green infrastructure, and implementing noise reduction measures in urban areas.","Technologies":"Electric vehicles, green spaces, noise barriers, and acoustic zoning.","People":"Residents in urban areas, vulnerable populations, and individuals with respiratory conditions.","Owner":"Local governments, environmental agencies, and urban planners."}]}
